definition: pediatrics/pediatric (department)/sth of little importance/trifle/a child's play/(slang) childish/petty/stingy
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Demonstrate ability to direct pediatric trauma resuscitations.
sentences.chinese: 有能处小儿科创伤的救护。

sentences.english: But they are petite compared with the lion’s mane jellyfish.
sentences.chinese: 但是和狮鬃水母比起来，它们只能算小儿科。

sentences.english: Results of Gartrells study will be published in the July issue of Pediatrics.
sentences.chinese: 加特雷尔的研究结果将刊登在七月版的《小儿科》上。

sentences.english: The study was published in this month’s issue of the journal Pediatrics.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果发表在这个月的小儿科杂志上。

sentences.english: Hector Ruiz's son Diego is currently in the paediatrics ward at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 鲁毅兹的儿子达各，最近住在医院的小儿科病房里。

sentences.english: By the standards of modern-day encryption techniques, substitution cyphers are child's play.
sentences.chinese: 按照现代加密技术的标准，置换密码简直就是小儿科。

sentences.english: The findings appear this month in the Joual journal Pediatrics.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现出自本月的小儿科日报。

sentences.english: I'm taking my daughter to a pediatrician for a general check-up .
sentences.chinese: 我要带我的女儿去给小儿科医生做个全身检查。

sentences.english: The study was published in the latest issue of the journal Pediatrics.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果发表于最近一期的《小儿科》医学期刊上。

sentences.english: Whenthebaby developed a fever, Mother telephoned pediatrician.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿发烧时，母亲会给小儿科医生打电话。

sentences.english: Topics of instruction include family theory, gerontology, pediatrics, and holistic health (an approach that takes into account overall health, including mental and social adjustment).
sentences.chinese: 课程包括家庭论，老年医学，小儿科和整体健康等。

definition: a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
small token/mere trifle (used of one's gifts)
lit. one hair from nine oxen (idiom)/fig. a drop in the ocean
insignificant talent/skill of no high order/minor accomplishment
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
